modules.description: This module supports combining, filtering, and querying I/O event conditions using bitwise operations like union, intersection, and negation. It operates on compact bitmask representations of event sets (`Polly.Events.t`), which map to Linux epoll's native event flags. Typical use cases include dynamically composing event masks for socket monitoring or inspecting active events during system call interactions.

This module implements an interface to Linux eventfd objects, supporting creation with customizable flags, reading current values, and atomic updates. It works with file descriptors and flag combinations to manage event notification channels between threads or processes. Concrete use cases include signaling between epoll-managed event loops and coordinating asynchronous I/O operations without requiring pipes or sockets.

This module implements an interface to Linux's `epoll` system call for efficiently monitoring multiple file descriptors for I/O events. It provides operations to register, update, and remove file descriptors from an epoll instance, and to wait for events with optional callback execution or result aggregation. Use cases include building high-performance network servers that handle many concurrent connections or implementing custom event loops for asynchronous I/O coordination.
